intro: Caryophyllus floribundus, commonly known as the floribundus carnation, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers in shades of pink, red, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces numerous small, fragrant blooms throughout the summer months. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often reddish in color. Caryophyllus floribundus is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
